title: The power of a 4 man premade.
body:
with the current system of reporting I see no point in trying to maintain honor any longer.
I have played this game since season 2 and I have been reported maybe 3 times in 8+ years.
I barely argue with people in game and I never use profane language or hate speech towards anyone.

I was on the verge of hitting honor 4 last season and I had one game with a premade of 4 people.
my support was inting and so I complained in chat and tried to ff, they all reported me and I was insta chat restricted and lost all honor.

Since then I climbed back nearly to honor 3 and then it happens again. I get put in a game with a premade of 4 people. I get shit on in top lane, camped by enemy jungle and have a hopelessly bad lane phase. My jungler literally does nothing to help me but I dont say anything. After a failed ff vote at 15 mins I pretty much give up on the game. I cant farm or get back into it and the enemy team is winning in every lane. Suddenly the adc on my team starts flaming me and blaming me for the game, so I defend myself in chat and point out what my teammates could have done to help the situation. I did not afk, I did not stop playing, and I did not even curse or say anything rude. I did die a lot but thats because the enemy team were all fed and we did not ff.

After the game my whole team (premade 4) reports me and I get a chat restriction and lose all my honor. so my question is why even bother trying to build up honor again? any 4 man can just report you and you are instantly punished. since when can you get a chat restriction for not even saying anything bad? the whole report system is such a joke, allowing butthurt losers to ruin someone elses experience is the opposite of what riot claims they are trying to achieve.

replies.body:
> any 4 man can just report you and you are instantly punished.

It doesn't work like that. Reports only trigger a review, and the review doesn't take how many reports were received into consideration.

If you haven't cleared your chat restriction, I suggest you copy and paste the chat logs here; you wouldn't have gotten punished for no reason, so odds are fairly high that you're either missing something or ignoring your own misbehavior out of bias.

And in case you doubt me on number of reports not mattering, here's [a quote from Riot Tantram sharing a snippet of the IFS code.](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/9VrUtrJo-being-solo-and-having-a-team-report?comment=0000000000020000000000000000)

> Reports haven't lost weight since the instant feedback system was put in place.
> 
> It's actually really simple.
> 
> if (reports > 0) {
> review();
> }

It reads the value stored in the "reports" variable as a boolean flag, and if there's any number of reports greater than a value of zero, it calls the "review()" function. Also worth pointing out; it's "review()", not "review(reports)", meaning that the review of your behavior is not influenced by the amount of reports you receive. Once the review() function is called, the amount of reports don't matter.

If you haven't cleared the punishment yet, you should be greeted with your chat logs any time you open the Client.

> i wont bother with a support ticket, riot will never reverse a decision

Kei143 wasn't necessarily recommending an appeal through Riot Support, but rather that Riot Support can also bring up your chat logs if you can't get them from the Client.

Maybe you should look at your chatlog closely and identify what is wrong in your chat. 

If you can't identify your own, you can paste you chatlogs here or submit a ticket to Riot support.

so saying anything unproductive in chat is bannable? I reported the ekko and the cait for flaming me and I am willing to bet they did not get any punishment.
again, im not saying I behaved well this game, but everything I said was in DIRECT RESPONSE to people flaming and blaming me. so I dont see how it is fair that I get punished and they don't.

First of all, if you want to directly respond to someone's comment, you can click the "Reply" button under the comment body.

> so saying anything unproductive in chat is bannable?

If unproductive chat was bannable, then people wouldn't be able to chat or bullshit around or do literally anything besides call out enemy cooldowns, locations, etc.

Your chat wasn't just unproductive, it was negative, harassing, inflammatory, and entirely unsportsmanlike.

> again, im not saying I behaved well this game, but everything I said was in DIRECT RESPONSE to people flaming and blaming me.

Flaming in response to flaming is...Still flaming. You're not given free reign to break the rules just because someone else broke them first. It doesn't matter who started it, if you participate, you are subject to punishment.

> I reported the ekko and the cait for flaming me and I am willing to bet they did not get any punishment.
>
> so I dont see how it is fair that I get punished and they don't.

Everyone has their own behavioral history. Your report was valid and will count against them - it may not get them punished from that match alone, depending on their behavioral history, but it can and will add up eventually.

Regardless, whether or not they got punished does not matter in regards to _your behavior_ and _your punishment_. You clearly have a history of misbehavior, given that you said yourself this is your second Chat Restriction.

So stop focusing on irrelevant details, like whether or not other players got punished or how you only responded to flame, and take a moment to take stock of your behavior. If you don't learn and change your behavior, you're just going to get punished again - and if this punishment was a 25-game Chat Restriction, then your next punishment is going to be a 14-day ban, and after that, a permanent ban.

Well, would you rather get punished for other players' behavior?

Chat logs only show _your_ behavior because you are punished for _your_ behavior alone. You alone are responsible for what you say and do; nobody else.

> Still, what here did I say that is worth reporting?
> ---
> Roger Fakerer: you let voli get 3 plates while failing an invade on red :P ekko bro pls help

Well, right off the bat you start harassing your Jungler for not ganking you and messing up an invade, as well as calling an early GG.

You can ask for a gank without insulting and aggravating your Jungler. "Hey, Voli's beating me down pretty hard, could I get a gank?" gets the same message across without harassing your teammate.

And you continue to argue and harass your teammates throughout the rest of the match, insulting Caitlyn and just generally wasting time rehashing stuff that's far too late to fix. Stop agonizing over how your teammates didn't help you early on and just take your own advice:

> Roger Fakerer: maybe you should pay attention to your own lane/

Because, seriously. Getting bent out of shape and focusing so much on how your teammates didn't help you or gank you or whatever else _is not going to help, **especially if you constantly harass them about it.**_

> I don't see anything here to cause a chat restriction.

The vast majority of this chat log is negative, full of detrimental arguments and littered with the occasional insult. You weren't punished because a 4-man premade reported you, you were punished because you wasted so much time harassing and arguing with your team when you could've just muted them and played the game.

In the future, here's my advice:

1) **Don't harass your teammates when asking for help.** Berating your teammates by commenting on how they "failed an invade" or blaming them for your lane opponent gaining ground on you only serves to make them **not** want to gank you. If you can't settle for "could I get a gank please?" with maybe an added "things are getting pretty rough", _don't even ask._
2) **Don't get hung up on singular mistakes.** The majority of that match had you arguing and harassing your team over the fact that you didn't get ganks early on, and guess what? _What you did was flame your team._ It doesn't matter if you didn't respond until they flamed you first (which I frankly doubt, given the very first line in your log), _you flamed them as well, and you were just as bad as them._
3) **If someone flames you, _mute them and ignore them._** Don't say anything to them, don't say anything about them, don't even give them the time of day. If they flame you, they are entirely unreasonable and there is **zero** benefit to trying to communicate with them. Fullmute them to shut them down, and then don't say anything even vaguely relating to them.
4) **Don't be a defeatist.** Excessive defeatism brings down your team's morale (and makes them less likely to cooperate with you - why help someone who thinks the match is already lost?) and doesn't help. Don't say early ggs, don't say "ff@whenever", if you think the match is lost, **keep it to yourself and play it out.** You can open a Surrender vote when it's available, but for real, just keep that negativity out of chat.

Your chat log is really toxic.
Punishment deserved.

Its a 10 game chat restriction, ive had 2 of these in 8 years. I dont think that qualifies as someone with bad behavior history. I've also been honor 4 every season since honor was introduced until last season. this is the point of my post.

I am not blaming my teammates for making me negative, I am aware it is 100% up to me how to behave, what I am saying is that by riot punishing this (what I see as very mild negativity) it discourages good behavior in normally positive players.

I go 99% of games without saying anything bad or negative to anyone. once in a blue moon I have a really bad game combined with flaming teammates that results in some unpleasant banter in chat. sure it's negative, but does it undo everything positive you have ever said? well according to riot, it does.

so why would I care about honor anymore, why would I try to be a positive member of the community when in one single moment of weakness it can all be undone. it takes many many months of excellent behavior and honors to get to lvl 4 and you can lose it all in an instant for something not even that bad.

I understand 100% why they punish people who use bad language, excessive cursing, derogatory terms etc, but I think chat restricting someone for the things I said is overkill, and psychologically it does not make me want to be a more positive community member, it has the opposite effect actually, it makes me not care or bother to even try and be good when I can lose everything over such a petty incident.
